alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 11:14AM CDT until April 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. .The Red River of the North has crested in Fargo and appears to be cresting at Grand Forks and Oslo. The Red River is expected to crest at all other sites through the course of this week. A batch of precipitation Tuesday and Wednesday may prolong flood impacts, although there is high uncertainty at this time regarding flood impacts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Fargo. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, North Broadway bridge floods (Fargo/Moorhead). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Monday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 17.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
